metadata.title: CVE-2023-52806 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ALSA:hda: Fix possible null-ptr-deref when assigning a stream While AudioDSPdrivers assign streams exclusively of HOST or LINK type, nothing blocks auser to attempt to assign a COUPLED stream. As supplied substream instancemay be a stub, what is the case when code-loading, such scenario ends withnull-ptr-deref.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52806` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-258-generic - 4.4.0-258.292~14.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-258-generic - 4.4.0-258.292~14.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-258-lowlatency - 4.4.0-258.292~14.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1135-aws - 4.4.0-1135.141
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1180-azure - 4.15.0-1180.195~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-258.292~14.04.2').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1135.141').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1180.195~14.04.1').
